title: Western Albemarle High School
summary: Attended Western Albemarle High School in Crozet, Virginia.

title: St. John's School
summary: Attended St. John's School in Guam. National Honor Society member and National Merit Scholar Semi-Finalist.
description:
• Tumon, Guam
  • National Honor Society
  • National Merit Scholar Semi-Finalist

title: Hopkins High School
summary: Graduated early from Hopkins High School in Minnetonka, Minnesota.

title: Congressional Intern — Office of Delegate Madeleine Bordallo
summary: Congressional intern for Delegate Madeleine Bordallo, Guam's representative to the U.S. House of Representatives and the first woman to represent Guam in Congress.
description:
• Congressional intern for Delegate Madeleine Bordallo, Guam’s representative to the U.S. House
  • First woman to represent Guam in Congress

title: Freelance Journalist — Pacific Daily News
summary: Freelance lifestyle journalist for the Pacific Daily News, Guam's primary newspaper. Covered local musicians, bands, bars, restaurants, and cultural activities across the island.
description:
• Freelance lifestyle journalist for the Pacific Daily News, Guam’s primary newspaper
  • Covered local musicians, bands, bars, restaurants, and cultural activities

title: BA, Linguistics — Northwestern University
summary: Studied linguistics with a focus on formal semantics, pragmatics, phonology, and syntax. Graduated Cum Laude and was inducted into Phi Beta Kappa Honor Society. Received the Demoz Paper Award from the Linguistics Department.
description:
• Focus on formal semantics, pragmatics, phonology, and syntax
  • Cum Laude, Phi Beta Kappa Honor Society
  • Demoz Paper Award, Linguistics Department
  • GPA: 3.81

title: Logic Year — University of Amsterdam (Fulbright)
summary: Awarded a Fulbright Scholarship to study at the Institute for Logic, Language and Computation (ILLC) in Amsterdam. Studied mathematical logic, philosophy of language, and formal linguistics. Published research on probabilistic inferences in dynamic semantics.
description:
• Fulbright Scholar at the Institute for Logic, Language and Computation (ILLC)
  • Studied mathematical logic, philosophy of language, and formal linguistics
  • Published “Probabilistic inferences in dynamic semantics” (SoLL 2009)

title: PhD, Linguistics — Stanford University
summary: Completed a PhD in Linguistics with a dissertation on the syntax and semantics of comparative constructions in English. Published 5 peer-reviewed papers, including collaborative work with Christopher Potts on natural logic. Received a Phi Beta Kappa Fellowship in 2014.
description:
• Dissertation: “The syntax and semantics of ordinary comparative constructions in English”
  • Published 5 peer-reviewed papers, including work with Christopher Potts on natural logic
  • Phi Beta Kappa Fellowship (2014)
  • Focus on formal semantics, mathematical linguistics, syntax, and phonology

title: Staff Writer — Doommantia
summary: Staff writer for Doommantia, an online music magazine covering underground doom and stoner metal. Contributed album reviews and artist interviews.
description:
• Staff writer for Doommantia, an online music magazine covering underground doom and stoner metal
  • Contributed album reviews and artist interviews

title: Founder — Djalali Tutoring
summary: Founded and ran a private tutoring practice for high school students in the San Francisco Bay Area. Taught English, Spanish, Math, AP Programming, AP Biology, and SAT/ACT Prep. All students achieved 30+ on the ACT and were accepted into the colleges of their choice.
description:
• Founded and operated a private tutoring practice for high school students in the Bay Area
  • Taught English, Spanish, Math (Algebra, Algebra 2, Geometry, Trigonometry, Calculus), AP Programming, AP Biology, and SAT/ACT Prep
  • All students achieved >30 on the ACT and were accepted into the colleges of their choice

title: Intern — Nuance Communications
summary: Research intern in Nuance's Natural Language Understanding group. Developed a Natural Language Understanding prototype based on Synthetic Logic, bridging formal linguistics research with industrial speech and language technology.
description:
• Developed a Natural Language Understanding prototype based on Synthetic Logic
  • Research internship in the Natural Language Understanding group

title: VP of Natural Language Technology — ClearGraph
summary: Built the core Natural Language Processing pipeline that translated natural language questions into structured database queries. Led development of a natural language interface for querying arbitrary databases. The company won the Celent Model Bank Award in 2017 and was acquired by Tableau.
description:
• Built the core Natural Language Processing pipeline for translating natural language into structured database queries
  • Led the development of a natural language interface for querying arbitrary databases
  • Celent Model Bank Award (2017)
  • Acquired by Tableau

title: Staff Software Engineer — Tableau
summary: Created the natural language technology behind Tableau's Ask Data feature, enabling users to query data visualizations in plain English. Scaled Natural Language Processing infrastructure with ElasticSearch-based semantic indexing. Published peer-reviewed research and was awarded 9 patents in natural language interfaces for data visualization.
description:
• Created the natural language technology behind Tableau’s Ask Data feature
  • Scaled Natural Language Processing infrastructure including ElasticSearch-based semantic indexing
  • Published “Inferencing underspecified natural language utterances in visual analysis” (IUI 2019)
  • 9 patents in natural language interfaces for data visualization

title: Director of Operations & Content Strategy — Style at a Certain Age
summary: Led editorial strategy and publishing operations for a nationally recognized fashion and lifestyle brand across two stints (2019–2021, 2022–2023). Drove substantial year-over-year revenue growth while doubling site traffic through strategic content optimization and data-informed growth initiatives.
description:
• Two stints: Sep 2019 – Spring 2021 and Jan 2022 – May 2023
  • Led editorial strategy and publishing operations for a nationally recognized fashion and lifestyle brand
  • Drove substantial year-over-year revenue growth while significantly expanding audience reach
  • Doubled site traffic through strategic content optimization and data-informed growth initiatives
  • Oversaw monetization strategy and partnerships, aligning content performance with business objectives
  • Directed end-to-end content lifecycle, from planning and editing to analytics and performance refinement

title: Principal Member of Technical Staff → Software Engineering Architect — Salesforce
summary: Led the integration of Tableau's Ask Data across multiple Salesforce clouds and represented Tableau on Salesforce's North Star AI council. Architected a next-generation analytics platform spanning multiple clouds. Led the integration of Tableau-acquired Narrative Science into the broader ecosystem and contributed to the CRMA database and query engine.
description:
• Led initiative to integrate Tableau Ask Data across Salesforce clouds
  • Tableau representative to Salesforce’s North Star AI council
  • Architected next-generation analytics platform spanning multiple clouds
  • Led integration of Tableau-acquired Narrative Science into the ecosystem
  • CRM Analytics database and query engine

title: CTO & Co-Founder — PerceptivePanda
summary: Co-founded an AI-powered enterprise feedback platform that was acquired by Zapier. Raised institutional pre-seed funding and was accepted into the StartX '24 fall cohort. Designed and built the platform from the ground up using Go, Python, and Kubernetes on AWS.
description:
• Co-founded AI-powered enterprise feedback platform; acquired by Zapier
  • Raised institutional pre-seed funding
  • Accepted into StartX ’24 fall cohort
  • Designed and built platform in Go, Python, and Kubernetes on AWS

title: Software Engineering Advisor — VesselAware
summary: Providing software engineering advisory for a maritime intelligence platform, guiding architecture and technical strategy.
description: • Software engineering advisory for maritime intelligence platform

title: Research Faculty, Senior Research Engineer — Georgia Institute of Technology
summary: Research faculty and senior research engineer at Georgia Tech, focused on Natural Language Processing and Artificial Intelligence research. Bridging academic research with applied engineering in natural language processing and machine learning.
description:
• Research faculty and senior research engineer
  • Focus on Natural Language Processing and Artificial Intelligence research
